```{r common, include=FALSE}
# Description: Common settings

# Packages ---------------------------------------------------------------
pacman::p_load(
  ggplot2,
  tibble,
  readr,
  dplyr,
  skimr,
  tidyr,
  stringr,
  reprex,
  rstudioapi,
  here,
  fs,
  rmarkdown,
  knitr,
  kableExtra,
  qtalrkit,
  fontawesome,
  webexercises
)

# automatically create a bib database for R packages
write_bib(c(
  "tidyverse", "readr", "rmarkdown", "dplyr", "usethis", "gitcreds",
  "quanteda", "textdata", "tidycensus", "sf", "rtweet", "skimr", "janitor",
  "ggplot2", "gridExtra", "reprex", "rvest", "fs", "purrr", "fontawesome", "webexercises", "corpora" # nolint: line_length_linter.
), "packages.bib")


# Plots ------------------------------------------------------------------

# Plot theme
theme_qtalr <-
  function(font = "", font_size = 9) {
    ggplot2::theme_minimal() %+replace% # nolint: object_usage_linter.

      ggplot2::theme(
        plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size * 1.5
        ),
        plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size * 1.25
        ),
        plot.caption = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size * 0.75
        ),
        axis.title = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size
        ),
        axis.text = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size * 0.75
        ),
        legend.title = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size
        ),
        legend.text = ggplot2::element_text(
          family = font,
          size = font_size * 0.75
        )
      )
  }

# Set theme
ggplot2::theme_set(theme_qtalr())

# Color palettes

if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
  # if output is latex, use greyscale palette
  custom_pal <- c("#000000", "#525252", "#717171", "#929292", "#BABABA", "#DADADA") # print palette # nolint: line_length_linter.
} else {
  # if output is not latex, use colorblind palette
  custom_pal <- c("#999999", "#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73", "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7") # colorblind palette #nolint
}

# Set color palettes
scale_color_discrete <- function(...) {
  ggplot2::scale_color_manual(..., values = custom_pal) # nolint
}

# Set fill palettes
scale_fill_discrete <- function(...) {
  ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(..., values = custom_pal) # nolint
}

# Set linetype
scale_linetype_discrete <- function(...) {
  ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(..., values = c("solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash")) # nolint
}

# Geom defaults

update_geom_defaults("smooth", list(colour = "#525252"))
update_geom_defaults("point", list(colour = "#929292"))


# Options ----------------------------------------------------------------

options(digits = 3) # number of digits to print

# Misc -------------------------------------------------------------------

# Avoid conflict with stats::filter
filter <- dplyr::filter

# Avoid kableextra from outputting HTML on kable tables
options(kableExtra.auto_format = FALSE)

# Avoid printing too many rows
options(tibble.print_max = 10) # print at most 10 rows

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  message = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  out.width = "100%",
  fig.align = "center"
)
```
